item.title: Git: quick tips
item.description:
Handy commands


  • Change a commit message (only if it has not been pushed to upstream)


    • $ git commit --amend -m "<NEW_COMMIT_MESSAGE>"

  • Merge multiple changes from a separate branch "branch-x" into current branch
    • $ git merge --squash branch-x
  • Pull changes from remote without creating "pseudo change" commits and rebase local changes on top of remote state
    • $ git pull --rebase
  • Merge and/or squash multiple changes (N number of commits) in current branch
    • $ git rebase -i HEAD~N
  • Push local branch to a different branch
    • $ git push origin branch-x-v2:branch-x-v2-sumit
Total 0 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0)
To ssh://git.server.com/pkg/MyPackage
 * [new branch]      branch-x-v2 -> branch-x-v2-sumit
  • Rename a remote branch without changing local branches 
    • $ git push origin origin/branch-x-v2:refs/heads/branch-x-v2-old :branch-x-v2
Total 0 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0)
To ssh://git.server.com/pkg/MyPackage
 - [deleted]         branch-x-v1
 * [new branch]      origin/branch-x-v2 -> branch-x-v2-old

Git Stash


  • Push uncommitted changes to stash 


    • $ git stash save "message"

  • See list of stashes
    • $ git stash list
stash@{0}: On branch-x: foo bar 1
stash@{1}: On branch-x: foo bar
  • See changes in a particular stash
    • $ git stash show -p stash@{0}
diff --git a/build.xml b/build.xml
index 6ce3fdf..15669ac 100644
--- a/build.xml
+++ b/build.xml
@@ -2,7 +2,6 @@
 
....
....
  • Remove a single stash from the list and apply to current state
    • $ git stash pop stash@{1}
On branch branch-x
Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/branch-x'.
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add ..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- ..." to discard changes in working directory)
 
        modified:   build.xml
 
Untracked files:
  (use "git add ..." to include in what will be committed)
 
        ....
 
no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
Dropped stash@{1} (caceeb6392c7a40dd8325f3a2fdf038342e629cf)
  • Apply a single stash without removing it from the list 
    • $ git stash apply stash@{0}
On branch branch-x
Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/branch-x'.
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add ..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- ..." to discard changes in working directory)
 
        modified:   build.xml
 
Untracked files:
  (use "git add ..." to include in what will be committed)
.....
no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
  • Create a branch out of a stash 
    • $ git stash branch my-branch stash@{0}
  • Drop a stash
    • $ git stash drop stash@{0}   
Dropped stash@{0} (f697125c22addf9cf31e8ac36b384857110fec0e)
  • Clear all stash
    • $ git stash clear

item.title: Python: pretty print json
item.description:
Original source: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/352098/how-can-i-pretty-print-json

With Python 2.6+


echo '{"foo": "lorem", "bar": "ipsum"}' | python -m json.tool

Or if the json data is in file:


cat <data_file> | python -m json.tool

Handly shell alias:

alias prettyjson='python -m json.tool'

item.title: MySQL: drop all tables
item.description:
mysql -Nse 'show tables' -u <user> -h <host> <dbname>| while read table; do \
mysql -e "drop table $table" -u <user> -h <host> <dbname>; 
done

item.title: Eclipse plugins
item.description:
1. PathTools: Provides contextual menu for console, explorer etc
  2. DBViewer: Manage your db instances right from eclipse
  3. Grep Console: Filter what you want to see in the console

item.title: Thunderbird plugins
item.description:
1. Thunderbird Conversations: Bring GMail conversation view to your inbox
  2. MinimizeToTray Revived: Minimize thunderbird to system tray
  3. LookOut: Support for M$ OLE data (calendar format, winmail.dat attachments etc)
  4. Provider for Google Calendar: Support for Google calendar
  5. Lightning: Support for calendar out of thunderbird
  6. Google calendar tab: Google calendar as a tab in thunderbird
